briefdescription.para: Draw canvas widget for the given invalidated area.

detaileddescription.para: Similar to draw(), but might be invoked several times with increasingly smaller areas to due to memory constraints from the underlying CanvasWidgetRenderer.

parameterdescription.para: The invalidated area.

simplesect.para: true if the widget was drawn properly, false if not.

briefdescription.para: Gets the start and end angles in degrees for the circle arc.

parameterdescription.para: Generic type parameter, either int or float.
The start angle rounded down to the precision of T.
The end angle rounded down to the precision of T.

briefdescription.para: Gets the end angle in degrees for the arc.

simplesect.para: The end angle for the arc rounded down to an integer.

parameterdescription.para: Generic type parameter, either int or float.
The end angle rounded down to the precision of T.

briefdescription.para: Gets the start angle in degrees for the arc.

simplesect.para: The starting angle for the arc rounded down to an integer.

The starting angle rounded down to the precision of T.

simplesect.para: The cap precision in degrees.

briefdescription.para: Gets the center coordinates of the Circle.

parameterdescription.para: Generic type parameter, either int or float.
The x coordinate of the center rounded down to the precision of T.
The y coordinate of the center rounded down to the precision of T.

briefdescription.para: Gets line width.

parameterdescription.para: Generic type parameter, either int or float.
The line width rounded down to the precision of T.

briefdescription.para: Gets minimal rectangle containing the shape drawn by this widget.

detaileddescription.para: Default implementation returns the size of the entire widget, but this function should be overwritten in subclasses and return the minimal rectangle containing the shape. See classes such as Circle for example implementations.

simplesect.para: The minimal rectangle containing the shape drawn.

briefdescription.para: Gets minimal rectangle containing a given circle arc using the set line width.

parameterdescription.para: The arc start.
The arc end.

simplesect.para: The minimal rectangle.

briefdescription.para: Gets minimal rectangle containing a given circle arc using the set line width.

parameterdescription.para: The arc start.
The arc end.

simplesect.para: The minimal rectangle.

briefdescription.para: Gets the precision of the circle drawing function.

detaileddescription.para: The precision is the number of degrees used as step counter when drawing smaller line fragments around the circumference of the circle, the default being 5.

simplesect.para: The precision.

briefdescription.para: Gets the radius of the Circle.

parameterdescription.para: Generic type parameter, either int or float.
The radius rounded down to the precision of T.

briefdescription.para: Sets the start and end angles in degrees of the Circle arc.

detaileddescription.para: 0 degrees is straight up (12 o'clock) and 90 degrees is to the left (3 o'clock). Any positive or negative degrees can be used to specify the part of the Circle to draw.

parameterdescription.para: Generic type parameter, either int or float.
The start degrees.
The end degrees.

simplesect.para: getArc, updateArcStart, updateArcEnd, updateArc
The area containing the Circle is not invalidated.

briefdescription.para: Sets the start and end angles in degrees of the Circle arc.

detaileddescription.para: 0 degrees is straight up (12 o'clock) and 90 degrees is to the left (3 o'clock). Any positive or negative degrees can be used to specify the part of the Circle to draw.

parameterdescription.para: The start degrees.
The end degrees.

simplesect.para: getArc, updateArcStart, updateArcEnd, updateArc
The area containing the Circle is not invalidated.

briefdescription.para: Sets the precision of the ends of the Circle arc.

detaileddescription.para: The precision is given in degrees where 180 is the default which results in a square ended arc (aka "butt cap"). 90 will draw "an arrow head" and smaller values gives a round cap. Larger values of precision results in faster rendering of the circle.

parameterdescription.para: The new cap precision.

simplesect.para: The circle is not invalidated.
The cap precision is not used if the circle is filled (if line width is zero) or when a full circle is drawn.

briefdescription.para: Sets the center of the Circle.

parameterdescription.para: Generic type parameter, either int or float.
The x coordinate of center.
The y coordinate of center.

simplesect.para: setRadius, setCircle, getCenter
The area containing the Circle is not invalidated.

briefdescription.para: Sets the center of the Circle.

parameterdescription.para: The x coordinate of center.
The y coordinate of center.

simplesect.para: setRadius, setCircle, getCenter
The area containing the Circle is not invalidated.

briefdescription.para: Sets the center and radius of the Circle.

parameterdescription.para: The x coordinate of center.
The y coordinate of center.
The radius.

simplesect.para: setCenter, setRadius
The area containing the Circle is not invalidated.

briefdescription.para: Sets the line width for this Circle.

detaileddescription.para: If the line width is set to zero, the circle will be filled.

parameterdescription.para: Generic type parameter, either int or float.
The width of the line measured in pixels.

simplesect.para: The area containing the Circle is not invalidated.
if the new line with is smaller than the old width, the circle should be invalidated before updating the width to ensure that the old circle is completely erased.

briefdescription.para: Sets precision of the Circle drawing function.

detaileddescription.para: The number given as precision is the number of degrees used as step counter when drawing the line fragments around the circumference of the circle, five being a reasonable value. Higher values results in less nice circles but faster rendering and possibly sufficient for very small circles. Large circles might require a precision smaller than five to make the edge of the circle look nice and smooth.

parameterdescription.para: The precision measured in degrees.

simplesect.para: The circle is not invalidated.

briefdescription.para: Sets the radius of the Circle.

parameterdescription.para: Generic type parameter, either int or float.
The radius.

simplesect.para: setCircle, setCenter, getRadius
The area containing the Circle is not invalidated.

briefdescription.para: Updates the start and end angle in degrees for this Circle arc.

parameterdescription.para: Generic type parameter, either int or float.
The new start angle in degrees.
The new end angle in degrees.

simplesect.para: setArc, getArc, updateArcStart, updateArcEnd
The areas containing the updated Circle arcs are invalidated. As little as possible will be invalidated for best performance.

briefdescription.para: Updates the end angle in degrees for this Circle arc.

parameterdescription.para: Generic type parameter, either int or float.
The end angle in degrees.

simplesect.para: setArc, updateArcStart, updateArc
The area containing the updated Circle arc is invalidated.

briefdescription.para: Updates the start angle in degrees for this Circle arc.

parameterdescription.para: Generic type parameter, either int or float.
The start angle in degrees.

simplesect.para: setArc, updateArcEnd, updateArc
The area containing the updated Circle arc is invalidated.

briefdescription.para: Simple widget capable of drawing a circle, or part of a circle (an arc).

detaileddescription.para: The Circle can be filled or be drawn as a simple line along the circumference of the circle. Several parameters of the circle can be changed: Center, radius, line width, line cap, start angle and end angle.

simplesect.para: Since the underlying CanwasWidgetRenderer only supports straight lines, the circle is drawn using many small straight lines segments. The granularity can be adjusted to match the requirements - large circles need more line segments, small circles need fewer line segments, to look smooth and round.
